alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 27 at 3:23PM EDT until July 27 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Sullivan County in central New York... Southeastern Susquehanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northern Lackawanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Southeastern Bradford County in northeastern Pennsylvania... North central Pike County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Wyoming County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 322 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Callicoon to Forest City to Mehoopany, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Scranton, Falls, Carbondale, Archbald, Monticello, Blakely, Dickson City, Vernon, Olyphant and Clarks Summit. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
